result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Brad A. Michalik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Harmful Material-Expose Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(b).
  • Possess Harmful Material-Expose Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(b).
  • Possess Harmful Material-Expose Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(b).
  • Possess Harmful Material-Expose Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(b).
  • Possess Harmful Material-Expose Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:44 a.m. Defendant Brad A. Michalik, in custody, in court with attorney Keith Franklin Ellison.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Ellison/Schiek statements to motion. Court finds no new factors presented and denies motion for good time credit. Court grants motion for costs to be assessed only on one count; remits costs for 4 of the 5 costs and orders amended JOC. Schiek requests that defendant keep Court advised of current address until DPA is successfully completed. Adj. 10:02 a.m.

03:53 pm - Defendant Brad A. Michalik in court with attorney Keith Franklin Ellison.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schiek/Ellison/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.  
Court Sentence - Concurrent
WHS/POP 2 yrs - May transfer probation out of state
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Jail 30 days w/Huber for all purposes - May serve in any WI County - To commence on/before 9-4-15 @ 4 pm - Each Count - CC 
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
Concerning defendant's appearance at sentencing hearing
DPA filed

02:40 pm - Defendant Brad A. Michalik in court with attorney Keith Franklin Ellison.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files Amended Information.  Defendant pleads no contest to all six counts.  Plea questionnaire and DPA filed (Count 1).    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of counts 2 through 6 but defers judgment on Count 1 and accepts the DPA.  Court adjourn for sentencing.  Bail continued.
concerning scheduling of court appearance
Plea hearing on February 17, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

10:15 a, - Defendant Brad A. Michalik in court with attorney Keith Franklin Ellison.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schiek states there is a joint request for another pretrial conference - it is a bit of a complicated resolution; adding five counts to the Information along with a DPA with many conditions.  Ellison believes there is a great likelihood of resolution - lots of details to work out.  Ellison requests a sentencing date in May if possible.  Schiek does not object to this delay.  Bail continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

03:31 pm - Defendant Brad A. Michalik in court with attorney Keith F Ellison.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.    Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information.  Ellison in receipt of Information, waives reading.  Ellison will proceed with Arraignment.  Ellison - In receipt of Information, waives reading and enters a not guilty plea on behalf of defendant.  Ellison statement to review of discovery by defendant.  Michlig statement to discovery.  Court grants defense request to view material by Ellison and defendant - no copy will be made/given to defense.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
State's and States Reply to Discovery

Schiek/Ellison to bond.  Court sets sig bond.  Prelim time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
